alert.note: Alert for DeWitt (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 7:17PM CST until January 28 at 9:15PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Guadalupe River Near Cuero affecting DeWitt County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Guadalupe River near Cuero. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, FM 766 (Hell`s Gate Bridge) closed due to water across roadway between Ed Blackwell Lane and Hell`s Gate Bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM CST Saturday the stage was 28.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 19.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 PM CST Saturday was 29.3 feet. - Forecast...The river has crested and is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 9.0 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Guadalupe River Cuero 24.0 28.5 Sat 6 pm CST 20.6 11.7 9.9 &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon at 130 PM CST.
